occupation: Co-Founder and Chief Development Officer at Fluxx | www.fluxx.io
headline: Co-Founder and Chief Development Officer at Fluxx
summary: To drive meaningful change within the social sector, I have cultivated a deep passion, established a dedicated company, and forged a career focused on advancing technology solutions for the global philanthropic sphere. With experience spanning the entire spectrum of company growth, from bootstrapped startups to established enterprises, I possess a proven track record in initiating and scaling initiatives, securing funding, cultivating strategic partnerships, and nurturing team expansion. I am a proficient problem solver with an unwavering work ethic, guided by an entrepreneurial drive and an innate thirst for knowledge.

experiences.title: Co-Founder and Chief Development Officer
experiences.description: I help shape the strategic direction and growth of Fluxx. My primary focus is cultivating diverse revenue streams, spearheading fundraising efforts, driving business development initiatives, and ensuring client success—all aligned with our overarching organizational mission.

experiences.title: NationSwell Council Member
experiences.description: The NationSwell Council (NSC) is a membership community of service-minded leaders; people who have achieved great things in their respective fields and share an authentic passion for service, taking action around solutions, and supporting each other as part of a shared community committed to moving our country forward. At the NSC, we believe that the solutions to the problems facing our country are out there; the people driving them just need the space to connect with other leaders who share their values – and they need a way to access the expertise and resources required to catalyze impact. That’s what we are here to do: bring together this special, diverse group of leaders to share, explore, experience, and accelerate what is working.

education.activities_and_societies: Womens Club Soccer, Kappa Alpha Theta

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: The 50 San Francisco Tech Companies You Should Know in 2020
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Introducing you to 50 small and mid-sized San Francisco tech companies that you should know, but may not have encountered in your tech media travels. All are headquartered within SF’s city limits and have been around long enough — they’re between two and 10 years old — to be making an impact on their industries. As a group, they are well-funded, have notable leaders, and are developing some truly innovative technology.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Meet Three Women Who Are Transforming Philanthropy Towards Collaboration
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
"Moving philanthropy from an ego-system to an ecosystem is one of the three big bets that female philanthropists are making. Apart from giving circles, more female philanthropists are rising up and creating strategic initiatives centered around collaboration. This article profiles three female thought leaders in this space, who are all working with diverse collectives."

https://www.forbes.com/sites/bonniechiu/2019/04/27/meet-three-women-who-are-transforming-philanthropy-towards-collaboration/#454ce17a5475

recommendations:
Mrinalini (Lani) Ingram



Kerrin is an extraordinary individual with talents above her years and with amazing passion for excellence.  I have known Kerrin for five years and managed her directly for much of this time.  During this time Kerrin took on highly complex challenges which required a great deal of creativity, organization, leadership and maturity.  These challenges generally consisted of very high profile activities with significant impact to the business including creating revenue recognition processes, managing a sales crediting team, leading large portions of the fiscal year sales setup process and running the PMO of a multi-million dollar sales finance operations porfolio.  Kerrin has a great deal of positive energy and is a natural people person which allows for strong relationships and great collaboration.  After I left my role in Sales Finance Ops, Kerrin continued to run the PMO directly under the VP, Sales Ops for quite some time with consistent positive results.  Kerrin is currently leading the Cisco finance organization in Web 2.0 collaboration tools which has required tenacity, creativity, passion and excellent communition skills at multiple levels of the organization.  I have enjoyed watching Kerrin's strong career progression and expect to continue to see great things from her in the future.

Toni Knudson



Kerrin drove the creation and implementation of an innovative Enterprise Web 2.0 portal to improve collaboration across  2500+ world-wide finance users.   Her vision and energy ensured that the portal was delivered on an extremely tight schedule and was well-received upon launch.    

I’ve been working with Kerrin since the launch to drive portal adoption and create valuable business solutions.   I greatly enjoy teaming with Kerrin – her passion around Web 2.0, and for life in general, is contagious.    I have watched her present to large, technophobic, executive-level audiences and win them over with her knowledge, enthusiasm, and on-point examples.  

Kerrin is able to combine her financial savvy, technical prowess, and genuine enthusiasm to motivate others to experiment with new ways of doing business.   This is true leadership.
